imdb.title: Kuroko no basuke
imdb.plot: Kagami meets Kuroko, the 6th member of the Miracle Generation, and they make a pact to defeat the other members of the team. A battle of light (Kagami) and shadow (Kuroko) begins.

episodes.title: I'm Just Going at Full Strength
episodes.plot: Tensions are running high after Seirin advances into the semifinals of the Winter Cup, with Kagami nearly getting into a fight with a rival player.

episodes.title: This Is Mine
episodes.plot: Kaijo and Fukada Sogo square off in the semifinal for the right to face Seirin, with Kise and Haizaki immediately resuming their grudge match.

episodes.title: Don't You Get in My Way
episodes.plot: The game between Kaijo and Fukada Sogo comes to a conclusion.

episodes.title: I Will Offer Them
episodes.plot: Akashi's ability to predict his opponents manoeuvres is unmatched, and the Shutoku team seem to be on the ropes. But they're not about to give up.

episodes.title: True Light
episodes.plot: The match with Kaijo gets off to a rocky start for Seirin as Kise's "Perfect Copy" ability thwarts their offence. Riko calls for a substitution.

episodes.title: Don't Belittle Us!!
episodes.plot: Kagami and Kise's ace showdown is thwarted when Kise is subbed out due to his foot injury, leaving Kuroko a gap to use his "phantom shot".

episodes.title: In Order to Win
episodes.plot: The match between Kaijo and Seirin continues and Seirin takes the lead of 15 points. Now, with last four minutes of the games remaining, Kaijo subs in their ace Kesse.

episodes.title: This Time, for Sure

episodes.title: He Is the Best Player
episodes.plot: The Match Between Kaijo and Seirin comes to climax. At the last 4 seconds remaining Seirin scores a basket and wins the match.

episodes.title: What Is Victory?
episodes.plot: Kuroko watches seirin high play and decides to enter seirin the next year.

episodes.title: Again and Again
episodes.plot: As the clock slowly ticks to zero, both sides give it their all in an epic conclusion to finish off the Winter Cup.

episodes.title: Kon'na Tokorode Au To Hana
episodes.plot: The first years participate in a street basketball tournament, with Kiyoshi subbing in for Kawahara. They run into Seiho and learn that only the top eight teams from the Inter-High can participate in the Winter Cup heats.

episodes.title: Uintaa Kappu De
episodes.plot: Momoi shows up at Seirin, where the second years are practicing. The first years and Kiyoshi return to Seirin, where Momoi explains that Aomine didn't play in the Interhigh finals due to injuries sustained during the Kaijo-Touou game.

episodes.title: Shidou!
episodes.plot: The Winter Cup preliminaries begin with Seirin versing Josei High. A member of Josei recognizes Kiyoshi as "The Iron Heart", one of 5 players who would have been considered prodigies of their time if not for the Generation of Miracles.

episodes.title: Kotae wa Hitotsu ni Kimatteiru
episodes.plot: Three other teams advance to the championship league along with Seirin; Shutoku High, Senshinkan High and Kirisaki Dai Ichi High. Seirin's first opponent is Senshinkan who are known as the "King of the West".

episodes.title: Mattetaze
episodes.plot: Seirin keeps a lead against Shutoku to the second quarter. But Kagami grows ever more tired, and Takao's hawk eye is a formidable weapon against Kuroko's Misdirection.

episodes.title: Tou no Mukashi ni Koeteiru
episodes.plot: Kuroko re-enters the game and takes on Midorima, easily passing him with his Vanishing Drive, and Seirin catch up to Shutoku with the third quarter ending in a tie. In fourth quarter, Midorima states that he passed his limits long ago.

episodes.title: Akiramero
episodes.plot: Startled by the buzzer, Kagami and Midorima fumble the ball which misses the hoop. Hyuga has realized that Kiyoshi is still injured and asks him to sit out the Kirisaki Daiichi match.

episodes.title: We're the Seirin High School Basketball Team!
episodes.plot: The next morning, the newly-formed basketball team shout from the rooftops before morning assembly that they will participate in the national tournament to become the best team in Japan.

episodes.title: I Will Defeat You!
episodes.plot: Hanamiya taunts Kiyoshi who doesn't react. This angers Hanamiya, who signals his team to injure Kiyoshi and Kiyoshi gets an elbow to the face, but manages to get up again, saying that he has vowed to protect Seirin.

episodes.title: It's Trust
episodes.plot: Kuroko asks Hanamiya why he plays in such an underhanded way and Hanamiya responds that he enjoys seeing the frustration of hardworking players. Aomine confronts Hanamiya in the bathroom and says he's going to lose.

episodes.title: Don't Be Ridiculous
episodes.plot: Hyuga continues to miss his shots, until the ball goes out of court and Kiyoshi retrieves it. Hyuga remembers his promise to Kiyoshi to become the best in Japan, and realizes they have never hi-fived.

episodes.title: Thanks
episodes.plot: After winning against Kirisaki Daiichi and confirming their spot in the Winter Cup, the Seirin team head to a hot spring to regenerate their energy. They are surprised when the Touou Academy team joins them at the resort.

episodes.title: Definitely This Time
episodes.plot: Kagetora claims that the second years of Seirin can improve their individual skills in less than a month, but when asked about Kuroko, he doesn't know what to teach him. Kagetora even said that Kuroko might face a wall.

episodes.title: Useless Effort
episodes.plot: Seirin gets their first points through Kuroko's Ignite Pass Kai, an improved version of his Ignite Pass, powerful that it even goes past Aomine's hand, followed by Kiyoshi's Right Of Postponement to provide a lob for Kagami to slam.

episodes.title: He's Beside Himself with Joy
episodes.plot: Timeout is over, and Kagami has gotten serious to try and raise Kuroko's spirits. Kagami's awakening of his real potential, due to him forgetting about his reliance on Kuroko, has enabled him to block Aomine from behind the back.

episodes.title: Win Now
episodes.plot: Imayoshi is able to immobilize Kuroko, and Sakurai manages to stop Hyuga's Barrier Jumper, both actions being instructed by Momoi. Aomine goes past Kagami and makes a 360 spin dunk. All 5 Touou players are now able to see Kuroko.

episodes.title: I Believe
episodes.plot: Still behind by 10, and Kagami has been unable to stop the faster Aomine, therefore Hyuga suggests to go 3 points at a time. Hyuga hits a 3 with confidence, even with Sakurai's tight defense on the former.

episodes.title: I Won't Lose
episodes.plot: An intense battle between the Aces, Aomine and Kagami, begins. The audience, as well as the other players, are amazed at the battle of the Aces in the Zone, which brings their focus and reaction speed to the maximum.

episodes.title: Tell Me
episodes.plot: Seirin team decides to find a place to rest and rejuvenate. Kagami offers the team an invitation to his house. After a restful night for the team, they find Alexandra Garcia, Kagami's master in basketball, sleeping in Kagami's house.

episodes.title: Of Course It's Not Easy
episodes.plot: While the match between Seirin and Nakamiya South progresses, at Touou Academy's library, Imayoshi and Susa discussed about Seirin's possibility of winning the match while studying.

episodes.title: First Basket!
episodes.plot: A team of high school basketball players work their way to the top to become the best in Japan.

episodes.title: It's Obvious
episodes.plot: Murasakibara cannot take Kiyoshi particularly, and decides to go to the other side of the court to join in Yosen's offense. This made the whole of Seirin shocked as they don't know how to stop Murasakibara.

episodes.title: I Don't Want to Lose
episodes.plot: With Murasakibara finally appearing on the offensive side, Seirin is slowly losing hope of having the chance to win against Yosen. Murasakibara catches the ball and dunks it, causing the hoop to break and collide with the ground.

episodes.title: Enough
episodes.plot: During the time out, Murasakibara said that he does not want to play even though they are still 4 points ahead, but Himuro is able to convince him back into playing. How would the match end up?

episodes.title: Win!
episodes.plot: Knowing that he is at his limits, Kagami exceeds them and attempts a lane up, but he does not have enough space to jump from that angle, and would not reach the hoop. Kagami then made his new move, Meteor Jam, over Murasakibara.

episodes.title: I Am Kuroko
episodes.plot: First-years Taiga Kagami and Tetsuya Kuroko join the basketball club, Kuroko challenges Kagami to a one-on-one match and fails to impress Kagami, Kagami declares he'll become Japan's best player. Kuroko states it is impossible for him to do it alone, but that he has decided to be the shadow to Kagami's light.

episodes.title: I'm Serious
episodes.plot: The coach sets up a practice match with Kaijou, a strong team, with one of the members of the Generation of Miracles, Ryota Kise.

episodes.title: It's Better If I Can't Win
episodes.plot: Seirin visit Kaijou for the match, and are insulted that the coach, Takeuchi, underestimating them, has only allocated half the court for the match and tells Kise to sit out.

episodes.title: Take Care of the Counter Attack!
episodes.plot: Kagami starts coordinating with Kuroko, and the flow of the game switches in Seirin's favor until Kise accidentally hits Kuroko, who has to sit out. Play continues, with Kagami focusing on defense and leaving attack to the 2nd years.

episodes.title: Your Basketball
episodes.plot: Midorima, the Generation of Miracles' number one shooter, shows up and chastises Kisg. Seirin visiting a steakhouse. Kise asks Kuroko why he left basketball in middle school.

episodes.title: Let Me Tell You Two Things
episodes.plot: The second years task the first years with getting some highly sought after "special bread" from the cafeteria. Seirin learns that they will face Shutoku in the finals of the Inter High preliminaries.

episodes.title: You'll See Something Amazing
episodes.plot: Kuroko is subbed out to conserve his energy, leaving Kagami to deal with Papa alone. Seirin finds out they will face two of the "three emperor teams" on the same day, with Seiho in the semifinal and Shutoku in the grand final.

episodes.title: Now That I Think About It
episodes.plot: Seirin's next match is against Seiho, who are known for their defense, and defeated Seirin the previous year, leading them to the brink of quitting basketball. Kuroko, is determined to win the match for the seniors.

episodes.title: To Win
episodes.plot: In Shutoku's game, Midorima subs out after only 5 minutes to conserve strength for the Grand final match. Kagami gets his 3rd foul, Seiho's Tsugawa speaks carelessly again, which only fires up Kuroko and third quarter is tied 19-19.

episodes.title: I Can't Have That
episodes.plot: The game with Shutoku begins, with Midorima blocking Kagami's attempt at an alley-oop. Midorima scores the first goal with a three, but Kuroko makes a surprise retaliation by passing across the court to Kagami, who scores with a dunk.

episodes.title: That's Not It
episodes.plot: The intense match between Seirin and Shutoku continues.

episodes.title: What Is 'Victory'
episodes.plot: 3rd quarter ends and Kuroko punches Kagami for saying they don't need team play right now, and Kagami calms down. Kuroko tells the team he has a plan.

episodes.title: I Believed in You
episodes.plot: The 4th quarter begins. Riko told Kagami he only has two more jumps left in him, and he uses the first to block Midorima as a bluff. Kuroko uses his misdirection on Takao to draw his attention to himself.

episodes.title: You Look Just Like Him
episodes.plot: At a nearby restaurant, Seirin encounter Kise, Kasamatsu, Midorima and Takao. Kuroko, Midorima, Kise and Kagami are left at the same table.

episodes.title: Don't Make Me Laugh
episodes.plot: Since he played basketball while recovering from his injury, Kagami is again suspended from practice until Seirin's first match in The Inter-High Championships which is against Touou; Aomine and Momoi's school.

episodes.title: Let's Go
episodes.plot: Even without Aomine, Touou takes an early lead using Momoi's scouting information and predictions. Seirin only manage to break through using Kuroko and Kagami, both of whom Momoi can't predict.

episodes.title: You're All Ridiculous
episodes.plot: Aomine goes one-on-one against Kagami - each blocking the other's shot at the goal. Kuroko asks to stay in for the third quarter, determined to beat Aomine. Kagami reminds him to have faith in the team, and Seirin decides to bench Kuroko.

episodes.title: No!
episodes.plot: Aomine's skills and erratic pace force Seirin to fall behind. Kuroko is subbed back in and Seirin cuts the lead down but Aomine intercepts Kuroko's Ignite Pass and taunts Kuroko about not having changed or improved since middle school.

episodes.title: On to a New Challenge
episodes.plot: Back in the locker rooms, Aomine is angered by a Touou bench member badmouthing Kuroko. Kagami tells Kuroko that they can win by just working together anymore, and Kuroko hits a slump, his passes in the next two games becoming inaccurate.

episodes.title: I Don't Want to Be
episodes.plot: Kiyoshi and Kagami appear to be evenly matched. Seirin begins the first of 3 consecutive days of practice matches so that each player can be placed on a specific training regimen during the summer.

episodes.title: Let's Get Started
episodes.plot: Riko announces two summer training camps; to the beach and the mountains, to prepare for the Winter Cup qualifiers which start right after summer vacation.

episodes.title: I'll Win Even If It Kills Me
episodes.plot: Kagami learns his jumping power has dramatically improved. Midorima tells him this is only half the answer, and challenges him to a one-on-one match.

episodes.title: I'm Not Mature!
episodes.plot: The match between Touou and Kaijo begins with Kaijo getting the ball. Kise manages to pass Aomine, but Aomine steals the ball.

episodes.title: Don't Get the Wrong Idea
episodes.plot: Kise plans to copy Aomine's style, acknowledging that his admiration of Aomine has been preventing him from copying him. While Kise perfects his copy, Touou is able to widen their lead.

episodes.title: Our Basketball
episodes.plot: Aomine asks for all the balls in the last quarter, and he and Kise alternate goaling. Kise starts to get fatigued, and the strain in his legs makes him almost miss a shot.
